name: places/ChIJ-Y9JTa9YwokRlUhyf1umPx4
formattedAddress: 39 E 30th St #2r, New York, NY 10016, USA
adrFormatAddress: 39 E 30th St #2r, New York, NY 10016, USA

originalText.text: Sign Language Center is simply awesome. I find myself laughing and smiling in every class, and learning ASL has expanded my understanding of human expression, connection, and perception. The instructors are Deaf and are so generous in their willingness to teach hearing folks like me about the culture and history and etiquette. My ONE criticism is that I'm a part-time wheelchair user, and the space is not wheelchair accessible. Unfortunately that's a reality of New York City real estate, and I don't hold it against them. It's just something to be aware of if you're considering taking classes at SLC and have mobility issues that would make it difficult for you to walk up stairs. Lastly... shout-out to Jamil! You're an amazing teacher and you're always cracking me up with your jokes!

originalText.text:
Sign Language Center in New York City is an outstanding institution for learning America Sign Language (ASL).  Learning the fundamentals of ASL from deaf teachers will give a strong foundation in learning sign language.  The focus of the center is immersion in deaf culture and the community.  They organize events and field trips for students to interact with the deaf community.  SLC offers both online and in-person classes.
Overall, the Sign Language Center is a great choice for anyone looking to learn ASL and gain a deeper understanding of the deaf community.

originalText.text: SLC is a fantastic place to learn ASL! The structure of the courses and individual classes are excellent and make the learning process clear and really fun! They have a really well designed curriculum. The teachers are all amazing, so humorous, patient and passionate to see their class succeed, and the management are very helpful and responsive. Highly recommend if you are seeking to go on a deep learning journey.

text.text: SLC is a fantastic place to learn ASL! The structure of the courses and individual classes are excellent and make the learning process clear and really fun! Highly recommend if you are seeking to go on a deep learning journey.

originalText.text:
I want to start off saying that I have had NOTHING BUT GREAT EXPERIENCES with the sign language center!!!!! Thanks to Alan, when I was sick and missed my classes he was so kind, considerate and helpful with making sure I didn’t miss a thing whether it was making up a class or a recording of my class!

I am so so thankful that I chose SLC to learn ASL! I will be sticking with them for as long as I can! And I even have family and friends that are excited to sign up for classes thanks to my experiences! Love them!

originalText.text: I highly recommend taking classes at Sign Language Center. The teachers are funny and brilliant. Their signing is, of course, terrific, but they are really good at meeting you where you're at: if you're just beginning, then Level 1 will work out really well for you. If you can sign your way through a long chat, perhaps you're ready for Conversation Level. I have taken each level at SLC and am back for more because I like the practice and I am always learning something new there.
